slides.title: Indian Constitution Basics
slides.content:
**Constitution of India:**
- **Adopted:** November 26, 1949
- **Came into force:** January 26, 1950
- **Father of Constitution:** Dr. B.R. Ambedkar
- **Longest written constitution** in the world

**Important Features:**
- **Preamble:** Introduction to Constitution
- Declares India as: Sovereign, Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic
- **Sovereign:** India is free and independent
- **Socialist:** Equal opportunities for all
- **Secular:** All religions are equal
- **Democratic:** Government elected by people
- **Republic:** Head of state is elected

**Parts of Constitution:**
- Originally 22 Parts, 395 Articles, 8 Schedules
- Currently: 25 Parts, 448 Articles, 12 Schedules

**Important Days:**
- January 26: Republic Day
- November 26: Constitution Day

slides.title: Fundamental Rights and Duties
slides.content:
**Fundamental Rights (Article 12-35):**

Originally 7, now **6 Fundamental Rights:**

**1. Right to Equality (14-18):**
- Equality before law
- No discrimination on religion, race, caste, sex
- Abolition of untouchability

**2. Right to Freedom (19-22):**
- Freedom of speech
- Freedom to assemble peacefully
- Freedom to form associations
- Freedom to move anywhere in India
- Freedom to practice any profession

**3. Right against Exploitation (23-24):**
- Prohibition of human trafficking
- Prohibition of child labor (below 14 years)

**4. Right to Freedom of Religion (25-28):**
- Freedom to practice any religion

**5. Cultural and Educational Rights (29-30):**
- Protection of language and culture
- Right to establish educational institutions

**6. Right to Constitutional Remedies (32):**
- Right to move court if rights are violated

**Fundamental Duties (Article 51A):**
- Added by 42nd Amendment (1976)
- Originally 10, now 11 duties
- Example: Respect National Flag, protect environment, etc.

slides.title: President and Prime Minister
slides.content:
**President of India:**
- **Head of State** (not Head of Government)
- **First President:** Dr. Rajendra Prasad
- **Current President:** Droupadi Murmu (15th President, First tribal President)
- **Term:** 5 years
- **Elected by:** Electoral College (MPs and MLAs)
- **Powers:** Supreme Commander of Armed Forces

**Important Presidents:**
- Dr. Rajendra Prasad (1st, 1950-62)
- Dr. S. Radhakrishnan (2nd, 1962-67)
- Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam (11th, 2002-07) - Missile Man
- Pratibha Patil (12th, 2007-12) - First Woman President
- Pranab Mukherjee (13th, 2012-17)
- Ram Nath Kovind (14th, 2017-22)

**Prime Minister:**
- **Head of Government**
- **First PM:** Jawaharlal Nehru
- **Current PM:** Narendra Modi (14th PM)
- **Leader** of ruling party in Lok Sabha
- **Head** of Council of Ministers
- **Real executive power** of the country

**Council of Ministers:**
- Headed by Prime Minister
- Collectively responsible to Lok Sabha
- Types: Cabinet Ministers, Ministers of State, Deputy Ministers

slides.title: Parliament and Judiciary
slides.content:
**Parliament:**

**Structure (Bicameral):**
1. **Lok Sabha** (House of People)
2. **Rajya Sabha** (Council of States)

**Lok Sabha:**
- **Members:** Maximum 552 (530 from states + 20 from UTs + 2 Anglo-Indian)
- **Currently:** 543 members
- **Term:** 5 years
- **Speaker:** Presiding officer
- **More powerful** than Rajya Sabha

**Rajya Sabha:**
- **Members:** Maximum 250 (238 from states + 12 nominated)
- **Currently:** 245 members
- **Term:** 6 years (1/3 retire every 2 years)
- **Chairman:** Vice President of India
- **Permanent House** (never dissolved)

**Supreme Court:**
- **Highest court** in India
- Located in New Delhi
- **Chief Justice:** Head of Supreme Court
- **First CJI:** Justice H.J. Kania
- **Current CJI:** Justice D.Y. Chandrachud
- **Judges:** 1 CJI + 33 Judges (Total 34)
- **Retirement age:** 65 years
- Guardian of Constitution

**High Courts:**
- State level courts
- First 3 HCs: Calcutta, Bombay, Madras (1862)
